thread.title: Schwarzenegger taunts Trump over low approval ratings | New York Post
thread.title_full: Schwarzenegger taunts Trump over low approval ratings | New York Post

author: Mark Moore
title: Schwarzenegger taunts Trump over low approval ratings | New York Post
text:
The ratings war is still raging.
Hollywood tough guy Arnold Schwarzenegger rekindled his feud with President Trump on Tuesday by goading him about his low approval ratings in a Twitter video.
“The ratings are in and you got swamped, wow,” “The Terminator” star said in the video . “Now you’re in the thirties.”
According to a Gallup poll released on Sunday , Trump’s approval rating has fallen to 37 percent, with 58 percent disapproving of the job he’s doing in the White House.
“But what do you expect,” Schwarzenegger said. “I mean when you take away after-school programs for children and meals on wheels for poor people. That’s not what you call making America great again.”
Schwarzenegger, the former governor of California, suggested Trump get out of the White House and visit Hart Middle School in Washington, DC.
“I’ll take you there so you can see the fantastic work that they’re doing for these children,” he said.
In a series of tweets in January, the president ridiculed Schwarzenegger , who had taken over from Trump as host of “Celebrity Apprentice,” for his low ratings on the show.
“Wow, the ratings are in and Arnold Schwarzenegger got “swamped” (or destroyed) by comparison to the ratings machine, DJT,” Trump wrote .
Earlier this month, Schwarzenegger said he would leave the show and blamed the low ratings on Trump.
“When people found out that Trump was still involved as executive producer and was still receiving money from the show, then half the people [started] boycotting it,” he said.
